td.content: 4.6 x 5.1 x 4.6 cm mass in the aortopulmonary window encasing the left pulmonary artery, a 1.9-cm subcarinal lymph node, and a mass in the left upper lobe of the lung measuring 2.5 x 2.1 cm with suspicious regional lymphangitic spread
shows 2 enhancing cerebral metastases of lung cancer in the left cerebral hemisphere
shows a presence of a right upper lobe mass, along with mediastinal lymphadenopathy and multiple small pulmonary metastases
showed increased uptake in the proximal phalanx of right ring finger and likely metastatic deposits in T9 vertebrae and several ribs
showed moderately to poorly differentiated metastatic adenocarcinoma in keeping with lung origin
